UnitType.Backstory: Long ago, Dagorath competed with Magnar II for Curgen's favor. To set himself apart, Dagorath sent out his mind beyond spacetime. He sought knowledge, but what found him was terrifiying, and powerful. Dagorath's mind returned to Elemental changed forever. He was immediately banished from Curgen's side, and hunted. But Dagorath hid, and waited, straining to hear the whisperings of the Old Spirits. Now at last he can re-emerge, as the chosen priest to open the void gates.

GameModifier.Provides: -10% Unrest in the city this unit is in
-10% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Description: When sacrificed according to Dagorath's secret rituals, the death of his citizens shall welcome these lesser terrors into Elemental, ready to fight for the opening of more gates.
UnitType.Backstory: When the desperate life force of a Red Quendar is sacrificed, Dagorath's spells create a rip in spacetime. A shred of void essence can then slip into Elemental, and the dead flesh of the sacrifice rises again as this lesser demon form. They shall serve loyally, and never tire: for they too share the grand vision of bringing the Void to Elemental.

UnitType.Description: These horrors have come through stable gates to crush your enemies.
UnitType.Backstory: These presences, taken flesh, are an affront to the nature of Elemental itself. They will rend the enemies of Dagorath, that even more might be ferried into this spacetime.

UnitType.Description: Only a level 5 city has the population necessary to create one of these powerful demons, but if you do so your enemies stand little chance.
UnitType.Backstory: You who face this abomination, know that countless suffered simply to birth it. And you must also feel pain and die, that it shall subsist.

UnitType.Description: This creature could only come through a stable portal to Elemental. It has a powerful long-range attack.
UnitType.Backstory: These abominations can project Eldritch energies that rot and degenerate flesh. Beware their presence in an army.

UnitType.Description: This creature could only come through a stable portal to Elemental. It gains levels like a hero and cast spells, but can die permanently.
UnitType.Backstory: This creature could only come through a stable portal to Elemental. It is a powerful Eldritch thing taken flesh, and shall grow very powerful here as one of your henchmen.

Dagorath will enslave any population he can control, not merely men. These Urxen tribes were desperate and starving when they encountered Dagorath's dark study. Now, they are too beaten in body and mind to even imagine that an empire of Urxen blood could be possible.

UnitType.Description: Use scouts to explore the world.
UnitType.Backstory: Dagorath will enslave any population he can control, not merely men. These Urxen tribes were desperate and starving when they encountered Dagorath's dark study. Now, they are too beaten in body and mind to even imagine that an empire of Urxen blood could be possible.

UnitType.Description: Pioneers are equipped with the necessary supplies to start new settlements and create outposts.
UnitType.Backstory: Dagorath will enslave any population he can control, not merely men. These Urxen tribes were desperate and starving when they encountered Dagorath's dark study. Now, they are too beaten in body and mind to even imagine that an empire of Urxen blood could be possible.

UnitType.Description: The broken citizens of Dagorath are also its soldiers.
UnitType.Backstory: Dagorath has mastered a strange spell that breaks the will, and tinges the skin red. These slaves have never known anything but Quendar captivity, and do not have the will to fight Dagorath;s influence.

'Discipline is first, second, and third when building an effective fighting force. Little else matters.' Indeed, the Red Quendar know these words well - for by losing themselves in discipline, they need not face the madness of the quest of their leader, who shall make Elemental into a Shadow World beyond recognition.
